newsitem.title: MEXICO: Teixeira Food to export 3,000 ostriches in 1998.
newsitem.headline: Teixeira Food to export 3,000 ostriches in 1998.

text.p: Mexican based livestock farmers Teixeira Food de Mexico plan to export 3,000 ostriches in 1998, the company president said on Tuesday.

"We are starting out with the idea of producing more than 3,000 head exclusively for export...and we will have the capacity to reach that target in 1998," said company president Jorge Sanchez in a telephone interview.

Teixeira Food de Mexico is a joint venture between U.S.-based Teixeira Food and some 40 Mexican livestock farmers located in the central Mexican state of Aguascalientes. The company's principal export markets are the United States and Canada, Sanchez added.
